summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors and defense attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, providing case materials, and mention evidence including phone records showing contacts with underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP representing an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in response to a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY. She coordinates meetings with prosecutors and requests case materials.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Associate at Winston & Strawn LLP working with Suzanne Jaffe Bloom on the grand jury subpoena matter. She assists with scheduling and communications.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of an unnamed client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Bloom is the defense attorney for an unnamed client who received a grand jury subpoena. The client is referred to with female pronouns and is likely Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell).

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date the unnamed client was subpoenaed to appear before the grand jury, which was adjourned pending discussions.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: Defense attorneys Suzanne Jaffe Bloom and Johanna Hudgens schedule a meeting with SDNY prosecutors to discuss the subpoena and potential voluntary interview.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed female client represented by Suzanne Jaffe Bloom.
Prosecutors mention possessing contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls.
The defense and prosecution were negotiating a potential voluntary interview of the client in lieu of a grand jury appearance.
Several civil case docket numbers related to Jeffrey Epstein are referenced: 15 Civ. 7433, 17 Civ. 616, and 08 Civ. 80736.
The email chain shows coordination between defense counsel and prosecutors regarding evidence sharing and scheduling, indicating an active investigation.
